ſame perſon ſo caſe queſtion although action brought one place nonage pleaded another county yet ſhall tried action brought therefore action brought midd triall midd good writ error nature originall plaintiff writ error formedon brigham verſus godwin formedon abate death one demandants upon new writ brought journes eſſoin lie writ brought journes account although eſſoined upon firſt writ account common bench kenricke againſt pargiter phillipps mich 〈◊〉 jacobi rot 213 robert pargiter gentleman john phillipps ſummoned common paſture anſwer robert kenricke gentleman plea tooke beaſts ſaid robert kenricke thoſe unjuſtly detained againſt suerties pledge c thereupon ſaid robert kenricke thomas pilkington attorney doth complaine ſaid robert john fourth day auguſt yeare reigne king ſeventh king sutton certaine place called great greene took beaſts ſay one gelding one mare one colt ſaid robert kenrickes unjuſtly detaine againſt suerties pledge untill c meanes ſaith worſe hath loſſe value twenty pound therefore bringeth ſuit c aforeſaid robert pargiter john phillipps john barton attorney come defend force injury c ſaid robert pargiter owne right doth well avow aforeſaid john phillipps bailiff ſaid robert pargiter doth well acknowledge taking ſaid beaſts aforefaid place c juſtly c becauſe ſaith ſaid place ſuppoſed taking ſaid beaſts made containe aforeſaid time ſuppoſed taking
